laboratory_examinations.findings: 7.8 mg/dl (1.95 mmol/liter), normal range 8.2–10.2 mg/dl (2.1–2.65 mmol/liter)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Before the study, serum calcium was 7.8 mg/dl; serum calcium increased from 8.0 to 8.2 mg/dl during a 6-h infusion.

laboratory_examinations.findings: PTH 1–84, 0.39 ng/ml (390 ng/liter); intact PTH, less than 8 pg/ml; PTH 1–34, 205 pg/ml (205 ng/liter)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Despite reduced serum calcium, PTH levels were inappropriate for the calcium levels.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 8.0 mg/dl (2.0 mmol/liter), normal range 8.8–10.5 mg/dl (2.2–2.63 mmol/liter)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Previous serum total calcium concentrations 9.5 and 9.7 mg/dl (2.38–2.43 mmol/liter) 8 and 16 months prior.
Repeat PTH was 36 pg/ml when total calcium ranged from 7.8–8.5 mg/dl.
One month later, it increased to 26 ng/ml.
Mild decrease observed over three determinations.
